dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: You know, it's like someone just flipped a switch from spring to full-on summer in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You know, it's like someone just flipped a switch from spring to full-on summer in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. I was just looking at the forecast for Astana and Almaty, and it's all sun, no rain from May 13th to the 15th.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. I was just looking at the forecast for Astana and Almaty, and it's all sun, no rain from May thirteenth to the fifteenth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Forecasters predict warm, sunny days with no rain in sight for Astana and Almaty from May 13 to 15.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and those daytime highs are climbing fast—like up to 33 degrees Celsius on the 15th in some spots. That's proper heat.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and those daytime highs are climbing fast-like up to thirty three degrees Celsius on the fifteenth in some spots. That's proper heat.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: May 15: Dry and breezy with southeast winds at 5"10 m/s. +15¦+17ÂC overnight, up to +33ÂC during the day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm, and the nights aren't exactly cool either—hovering around 15 to 20 degrees. Not much relief if you're trying to sleep without AC.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm, and the nights aren't exactly cool either-hovering around fifteen to twenty degrees. Not much relief if you're trying to sleep without A C.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: May 15: Clear skies continue with southwest wind 3"8 m/s. +18¦+20ÂC at night, and a sweltering +32¦+34ÂC by day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the wind speeds, uh, they're talking 3 to 8 meters per second, maybe even up to 10. So it's not just hot, it's breezy too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the wind speeds, uh, they're talking three to eight meters per second, maybe even up to ten. So it's not just hot, it's breezy too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: May 15: Dry and breezy with southeast winds at 5"10 m/s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which honestly might make it feel a bit more bearable? But still, authorities are warning people to stay hydrated and avoid the sun during peak hours.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which honestly might make it feel a bit more bearable? But still, authorities are warning people to stay hydrated and avoid the sun during peak hours.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Authorities are advising residents to stay hydrated and avoid direct sun during peak hours, especially on May 15 when the heat will reach its peak.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Especially on May 15th—they'reaching sweltering highs, like 34 degrees in some areas. That's intense for mid-May.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Especially on May fifteenth-they'reaching sweltering highs, like thirty four degrees in some areas. That's intense for mid-May.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: May 15: Clear skies continue with southwest wind 3"8 m/s. +18¦+20ÂC at night, and a sweltering +32¦+34ÂC by day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And this isn't just isolated—it's part of a nationwide heatwave. Southern Kazakhstan could hit 44 degrees! That's almost desert-level heat.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And this isn't just isolated-it's part of a nationwide heatwave. Southern Kazakhstan could hit forty four degrees! That's almost desert-level heat.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This localized warm spell is part of a broader nationwide heatwave, with temperatures in southern Kazakhstan forecast to reach up to +44ÂC, while central regions could see up to +38ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, the west and north are getting rain and thunderstorms. It's like the country's split right down the middle weather-wise.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, the west and north are getting rain and thunderstorms. It's like the country's split right down the middle weather-wise.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rain and thunderstorms, however, are expected to hit the western and northern parts of the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, totally uneven. One half is baking, the other's getting soaked.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, totally uneven. One half is baking, the other's getting soaked.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Makes you wonder how people are adapting—like, are folks in Astana just living by fans and cold drinks right now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes you wonder how people are adapting-like, are folks in Astana just living by fans and cold drinks right now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Probably! And you know, with temps that high, it's not just about comfort—it's a health risk too. Elderly folks, kids…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Probably! And you know, with temps that high, it's not just about comfort-it's a health risk too. Elderly folks, kids...

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Hope everyone's taking those warnings seriously. Stay shady, stay cool.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Hope everyone's taking those warnings seriously. Stay shady, stay cool.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. Let's hope this heat breaks soon—or at least doesn't stick around too long.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. Let's hope this heat breaks soon-or at least doesn't stick around too long.
